page.title: 10Industry-Salt
page.content: Rock salt was first discovered at map ref 03610472 in 1872 by engineers from Barrow looking for haematite.It occupies a large lens 800' to 1200' below surface within Keuper Marl.At first brine from the surface of the deposit was pumped up and piped across the bed of the Wyre to the Fleetwood Salt Co. at Burn Naze.This was stopped in 1891 due to the land subsidence when the unsupported Keuper Marl collapsed.These water filled Flashes are numerous,some are dangerously deep.For a short time brine was pumped from the bottom of the deposit but this was not economic.In 1893 deep mining began (map ref.036204779). There were 2 levels, each mining 22' of salt from passages at right angles to each other, with large square pillars left for roof support.
